availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles S. Savage (Bracken County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth P. Burgess Savage. Father of Mary C. Savage. Physician in Bracken County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Director of the Bracken County Agricultural Society in 1864. Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Germantown, Kentucky, in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 124; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 5; Find A Grave, "Dr. C. S. Savage (1829-1913)," Memorial #102765277, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=102765277&ref=acom (accessed May 24, 2017); Maysville Weekly Bulletin (Maysville, Ky.), May 6, 1864, p. 2; KYR-0001-007-0309.
